intro: Platostoma tridechii, commonly known as the yellow star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rocky substrates. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a flattened, leaf-like body that is covered in small, greenish-yellow lobes. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its lobes. Platostoma tridechii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its natural ecosystem.
